page.title: 19THE NAVYARD WHARF
page.content: THE NAVYARD WAS BUILT IN 1963 ON AN OLD SHIP REPAIR SITE. IT WAS BUILT ON STEEL PILES IN THE HARBOUR. IT COVERS 11 ACRES ND HAS A 3 LEVEL CAR PARK FOR THE TRADE CARS. THE MAIN CARGOES ARE CARS, COMMERCIAL VEHICLES, TRACTORS AND INDUSTRIAL MOBILE MACHINES. SHIPS RUN DAILY TO ANTWERP AND GOODS FOR OTHER COUNTRIES ARE OFTEN TRANSFERRED TO OTHER SHIPS AT ANTWERP, TO GO TO AMERICA, INDIA, AFRICA ETC. SHIPS ALSO COME IN FROM GERMANY, SWEDEN AND FINLAND. THE FINNISH SHIP CARRIES PAPER, PLYWOOD, CHIPBOARD AND CELLULOSE FIBRE MAINLY. THEY ALSO BRING GOODS FROM RUSSIA - RECENTLY ITEMS SUCH AS BIRTHDAY CARDS. CHRISTMAS CARDS, KIDDIES BOOKS ETC. THE NAVYARD WHARF EMPLOYS ABOUT 165 MEN AND HAS A STORAGE DEPOT AT THE TRANSIT CAMP FOR THE GOODS BROUGHT INTO THE COUNTRY IN CONTAINERS.
